pull.title: Clarify include guard naming convention
pull.body:
* **Documentation**: Document include guard convention
* **Fix**: Fix missing or inconsistent include guards
* **Regression test**: Add `lint-include-guards.sh` which checks include guard consistency

events.message: Fix missing or inconsistent include guards

events.body:
Concept ACK.

Could run script in travis where `CHECK_DOC=1` to prevent future PR's breaking it?

@promag `contrib/devtools/lint-*.sh` is executed automatically by Travis (via `lint-all.sh` which is run as part of `CHECK_DOC=1`). In other words `contrib/devtools/lint-include-guards.sh` will be executed by Travis â€“ no need to reference it explicitly :-)

events.message: Add lint-include-guards.sh which checks include guard consistency

events.body: @eklitzke Thanks for reviewing! Feedback addressed. Please re-review :-)

issue.title: Bech32 encoding support
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#8578
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11167
  - Only the second and third commits (first is in #3228, fourth depends on #2390, later ones are SegWit-specific).
- bitcoin/bitcoin#12757
  - Only the change to `src/bech32.h`

Part of #3058.

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.

issue.title: Update benchmark suite
issue.body:
Updating the bench suite with a bunch of goodies, among them linux perf profiling. This will be needed to evaluate more efficiently an upcoming port from BCHN that will probably improve the performance of the RPC interface.   

This PR contains a series of port from Core: 

bitcoin/bitcoin#11517
bitcoin/bitcoin#12757
bitcoin/bitcoin#12197
bitcoin/bitcoin#13025
bitcoin/bitcoin#13219
bitcoin/bitcoin#11646

labels.name: S-committed

comments.body: Do you really need bitcoin-config.h and build.h in here? They're auto-generated so I would have thought git ls-files wouldn't have listed them.
You should probably add a copyright notice to this file.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+#
+# Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+#
+# Check include guards.
+
+HEADER_ID_PREFIX="BITCOIN_"
+HEADER_ID_SUFFIX="_H"
+
+REGEXP_EXCLUDE_FILES_WITH_PREFIX="src/(crypto/ctaes/|leveldb/|secp256k1/|tinyformat.h|univalue/)"
+
+EXIT_CODE=0
+for HEADER_FILE in $(git ls-files -- "*.h" | grep -vE "^${REGEXP_EXCLUDE_FILES_WITH_PREFIX}")
comments.body: Could use `git ls-files -x` instead of `| grep -vE`?

comments.body:
@promag No I don't think so (`-x` is for untracked files, right?) :-)

I'd be glad to be proven wrong so provide an equivalent using `git ls-files -x` and I'll switch :-)
